intro: Inula britannica var. oelandica, commonly known as the Oeland ragwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe, particularly Denmark and southern Sweden. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils. It features yellowish-green ray flowers and a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
